trans-unit.source: How can I move or clone my Team Foundation Server installation?
trans-unit.target: How can I move or clone my Team Foundation Server installation?

trans-unit.source: You can move or clone your deployment of Team Foundation Server (TFS) software.
trans-unit.target: You can move or clone your deployment of Team Foundation Server (TFS) software.

trans-unit.source: You move TFS from one machine to another by restoring it to new hardware (called a restoration-based move).
trans-unit.target: You move TFS from one machine to another by restoring it to new hardware (called a restoration-based move).

trans-unit.source: For example, you might want to move TFS to a server with greater capacity or improved processing speed.
trans-unit.target: For example, you might want to move TFS to a server with greater capacity or improved processing speed.

trans-unit.source: When you move to a new server you do not lose any of your project history.
trans-unit.target: When you move to a new server you do not lose any of your project history.

trans-unit.source: To clone your TFS deployment, you perform the same steps as a move plus a few additional ones.
trans-unit.target: To clone your TFS deployment, you perform the same steps as a move plus a few additional ones.

trans-unit.source: You perform a move when you plan to discontinue use of the original hardware and TFS deployment.
trans-unit.target: You perform a move when you plan to discontinue use of the original hardware and TFS deployment.

trans-unit.source: You perform a clone when you intend to continue using the original TFS instance.
trans-unit.target: You perform a clone when you intend to continue using the original TFS instance.

trans-unit.source: Please see Move or Clone Team Foundation Server from one hardware to another for details
trans-unit.target: Please see Move or Clone Team Foundation Server from one hardware to another for details
